Question
========

In 80 newborns, it was determined whether they had a low birth weight (\< 2500 g.) and what the mother's age was (under 20 or not). The results were as follows: Of the 20 mothers under 20 years of age 8 had a low birth weight baby, of the 60 mothers aged 20 years and older, 16 had a low birth weight baby. We randomly choose one of the 80 children. Suppose the child has a low birth weight. The probability that the mother is 20 years or older is

Answerlist
----------

* 0.4
* 0.27
* 0.75
* 0.67

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.4: Incorrect
* 0.27: Incorrect
* 0.75: Correct
* 0.67: Incorrect
